intro: Ternstroemia killipiana, commonly known as the Killip's ternstroemia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
